025package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.hsluv;
026
027import com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.FloatColors;
028import com.github.tommyettinger.digital.BitConversion;
029import com.github.tommyettinger.digital.TrigTools;
030import com.github.tommyettinger.random.EnhancedRandom;
031
032import java.util.Random;
033
034/**
035 * Contains code for manipulating colors as {@code int} and packed {@code float} values in the HSLuv color space.
036 * See <a href="https://www.hsluv.org/">HSLuv's website</a> for more info.
037 * <br>
038 * The HSLuv color space has 3 channels, Hue, Saturation, and Lightness. Lightness should be much more even when hue and
039 * saturation change, when compared with "vanilla" HSL or HSV. This also has an alpha channel in each color,
040 * which acts like it does in every other color space package here (multiplicative alpha, higher is more opaque).
041 */
042public class ColorTools {
043    /**
044     * No need to instantiate.
045     */
046    private ColorTools(){
047    }
048    /**
049     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, here, hue, saturation, lightness, and
050     * alpha (or opacity). H should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0.0f or so meaning reddish, 0.3f or so meaning
051     * greenish, and 0.7 or so meaning bluish. S should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 meaning grayscale and 1
052     * meaning fully bold/bright. L should be between 0 and 1, inclusive, with 0 used for very dark colors (almost only
053     * black), and 1 used for very light colors (almost only white). Alpha is the multiplicative opacity of the color,
054     * and acts like RGBA's alpha.
055     *
056     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
057     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
058     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
059     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
060     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
061     */
062    public static float hsluv(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
063        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(((int) (alpha * 255.999f) << 24 & 0xFE000000) | ((int) (l * 255.999f) << 16 & 0xFF0000)
064                | ((int) (s * 255.999f) << 8 & 0xFF00) | ((int) (h * 255.999f) & 0xFF));
065    }
066    /**
067     * Gets a packed float representation of a color given as 4 float components, H, S, L, and alpha, with the S, L, and
068     * alpha components clamped to the 0f to 1f range before being entered into the packed float color, while H is
069     * wrapped into the same range. This is only different from {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} in that it
070     * clamps or wraps each component.
071     *
072     * @see #hsluv(float, float, float, float) This uses the same definitions for H, S, L, and alpha as hsluv().
073     * @param h     0f to 1f, hue component, with 0.0f meaning red, 0.3 meaning green, and 0.7 meaning blue
074     * @param s     0f to 1f, saturation component, with 0.0f meaning grayscale and 1.0f meaning fully bold/bright
075     * @param l     0f to 1f, lightness component, with 0.5f meaning "no change" and 1f brightening
076     * @param alpha 0f to 1f, 0f makes the color transparent and 1f makes it opaque
077     * @return a float encoding a color with the given properties
078     */
079    public static float clamp(float h, float s, float l, float alpha) {
080        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat((Math.min(Math.max((int) (alpha * 127.999f), 0), 127) << 25)
081                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (l * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 16)
082                | (Math.min(Math.max((int) (s * 255.999f), 0), 255) << 8)
083                | (int) ((h - floor(h)) * 256f)
084        );
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * An approximation of the cube-root function for float inputs and outputs.
089     * This can be about twice as fast as {@link Math#cbrt(double)}. This
090     * version does not tolerate negative inputs, because in the narrow use
091     * case it has in this class, it never is given negative inputs.
092     * <br>
093     * Has very low relative error (less than 1E-9) when inputs are uniformly
094     * distributed between 0 and 512, and absolute mean error of less than
095     * 1E-6 in the same scenario. Uses a bit-twiddling method similar to one
096     * presented in Hacker's Delight and also used in early 3D graphics (see
097     * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_inverse_square_root for more, but
098     * this code approximates cbrt(x) and not 1/sqrt(x)). This specific code
099     * was originally by Marc B. Reynolds, posted in his "Stand-alone-junk"
100     * repo: https://github.com/Marc-B-Reynolds/Stand-alone-junk/blob/master/src/Posts/ballcube.c#L182-L197 .
101     * It's worth noting that while hardware instructions for finding the
102     * square root of a float have gotten extremely fast, the same is not
103     * true for the cube root (which has to allow negative inputs), so while
104     * the bit-twiddling inverse square root is no longer a beneficial
105     * optimization on current hardware, this does seem to help.
106     * <br>
107     * This is used when converting from RGB to HSLuv, as an intermediate step.
108     * @param x any non-negative finite float to find the cube root of
109     * @return the cube root of x, approximated
110     */
111    private static float cbrtPositive(float x) {
112        int ix = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(x);
113        final float x0 = x;
114        ix = (ix>>>2) + (ix>>>4);
115        ix += (ix>>>4);
116        ix += (ix>>>8) + 0x2A5137A0;
117        x  = BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(ix);
118        x  = 0.33333334f*(2f * x + x0/(x*x));
119        x  = 0.33333334f*(1.9999999f * x + x0/(x*x));
120        return x;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * The same as floor() from libGDX's MathUtils class, this gets the int floor of a float between -16384 and 16384.
125     * @param f a float between -16384 and 16384
126     * @return the floor of f, as an int
127     */
128    private static int floor(final float f) {
129        return (int)(f + 0x1p14) - 0x4000;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Used when given non-linear sRGB inputs to make them linear, using an exact gamma of 2.4 and accounting for the
134     * darkest colors with a different formula. This is rather close to squaring {@code component}.
135     * @param component any non-linear channel of a color, to be made linear
136     * @return a linear version of component
137     */
138    private static float forwardGamma(final float component) {
139        return component < 0.04045f ? component * (1f/12.92f) : (float)Math.pow((component + 0.055f) * (1f/1.055f), 2.4f);
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Used to return from a linear, gamma-corrected input to an sRGB, non-linear output, using an exact gamma of 2.4
144     * and accounting for the darkest colors with a different formula. This is mostly similar to the square root, but is
145     * more precise for very dark colors.
146     * @param component a linear channel of a color, to be made non-linear
147     * @return a non-linear version of component
148     */
149    private static float reverseGamma(final float component) {
150        return component < 0.0031308f ? component * 12.92f : (float)Math.pow(component, 1f/2.4f) * 1.055f - 0.055f;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Changes the curve of a requested L value so that it matches the internally-used curve. This takes a curve with a
155     * dark area similar to sRGB (a fairly small one), and makes it significantly larger. This is typically used on
156     * "to HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
157     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
158     * @return an adjusted L value that can be used internally
159     */
160    public static float forwardLight(final float L) {
161        final float shape = 0.8528f, turning = 0.1f;
162        final float d = turning - L;
163        if(d < 0)
164            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
165        else
166            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
167    }
168    /**
169     * Changes the curve of the internally-used lightness when it is output to another format. This makes the dark area
170     * area smaller, matching (kind-of) the curve that the standard sRGB lightness uses. This is typically used on "from
171     * HSLuv" conversions. This is much less potent of a change than the method used by Oklab.
172     * @param L lightness, from 0 to 1 inclusive
173     * @return an adjusted L value that can be fed into a conversion to RGBA or something similar
174     */
175    public static float reverseLight(final float L) {
176        final float shape = 1.1726f, turning = 0.1f;
177        final float d = turning - L;
178        if(d < 0)
179            return ((1f - turning) * (L - 1f)) / (1f - (L + shape * d)) + 1f;
180        else
181            return (turning * L) / (1e-20f + (L + shape * d));
182    }
183
184    static private final float[][] m = new float[][] {
185            new float[] {+3.2404542f, -1.5371385f, -0.4985314f},
186            new float[] {-0.9692660f, +1.8760108f, +0.0415560f},
187            new float[] {+0.0556434f, -0.2040259f, +1.0572252f},
188    };
189    static final float[][] minv = new float[][] {
190            new float[] {0.4124564f, 0.3575761f, 0.1804375f},
191            new float[] {0.2126729f, 0.7151522f, 0.0721750f},
192            new float[] {0.0193339f, 0.1191920f, 0.9503041f},
193    };
194    static private final float refU = 0.19783000664283f, refV = 0.46831999493879f;
195    static final float kappa = 9.032962962f, epsilon = 0.0088564516f;
196
197    /**
198     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)} to an RGBA8888 int.
199     * This format of int can be used with Pixmap and in some other places in libGDX.
200     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
201     * @return an RGBA8888 int color
202     */
203    public static int toRGBA8888(final float packed)
204    {
205        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
206        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
207        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
208        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
209
210        // HSLuv to Lch
211        float C;
212        if (L > 0.99999f) {
213            L = 1;
214            C = 0;
215        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
216            L = 0;
217            C = 0;
218        } else
219            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
220
221        // Lch to Luv
222        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
223        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
224
225        // Luv to XYZ
226        float x, y, z;
227        if (L < 0.00001f) {
228            return (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
229        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
230            return 0xFFFFFF00 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
231        }else {
232            if (L <= 0.08f)
233                y = L / kappa;
234            else {
235                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
236                y *= y * y;
237            }
238            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
239            float varU = U * iL + refU;
240            float varV = V * iL + refV;
241            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
242            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
243        }
244        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z) * 255.999f);
245        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z) * 255.999f);
246        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z) * 255.999f);
247        return r << 24 | g << 16 | b << 8 | (decoded & 0xfe000000) >>> 24 | decoded >>> 31;
248    }
249
250    /**
251     * Converts a packed float color in the format produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
252     * to a packed float in ABGR8888 format.
253     * This format of float can be used with the standard SpriteBatch and in some other places in libGDX.
254     * @param packed a packed float color, as produced by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
255     * @return a packed float color as ABGR8888
256     */
257    public static float toRGBA(final float packed)
258    {
259        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
260        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
261        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
262        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
263
264        // HSLuv to Lch
265        float C;
266        if (L > 0.99999f) {
267            L = 1;
268            C = 0;
269        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
270            L = 0;
271            C = 0;
272        } else
273            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
274
275        // Lch to Luv
276        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
277        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
278
279        // Luv to XYZ
280        float x, y, z;
281        if (L < 0.00001f) {
282            return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(decoded & 0xfe000000);
283        } else if(L > 0.9999f) {
284            return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(0xFFFFFF | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
285        }else {
286            if (L <= 0.08f)
287                y = L / kappa;
288            else {
289                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
290                y *= y * y;
291            }
292            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
293            float varU = U * iL + refU;
294            float varV = V * iL + refV;
295            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
296            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
297        }
298        final int r = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
299        final int g = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
300        final int b = (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
301        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(r | g << 8 | b << 16 | (decoded & 0xfe000000));
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Takes a color encoded as an RGBA8888 int and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
306     * @param rgba an int with the channels (in order) red, green, blue, alpha; should have 8 bits per channel
307     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
308     */
309    public static float fromRGBA8888(final int rgba) {
310        final float r = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 24) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
311        final float g = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
312        final float b = forwardGamma((rgba >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
313
314        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
315        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
316        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
317
318        // XYZ to Luv
319        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
320        if (L < 0.00001f) {
321            L = 0;
322            U = 0;
323            V = 0;
324        } else {
325            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
326            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
327        }
328
329        // Luv to Lch
330        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
331        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
332
333        // Lch to HSLuv
334        if (L > 0.99999f) {
335            s = 0;
336            l = 1;
337        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
338            s = 0;
339            l = 0;
340        } else {
341            l = forwardLight(L);
342            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
343        }
344        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
345                          Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
346                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
347                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
348                        | (rgba & 0xFE) << 24);
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Takes a color encoded as an ABGR packed float and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
353     * @param packed a packed float in ABGR8888 format, with A in the MSB and R in the LSB
354     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
355     */
356    public static float fromRGBA(final float packed) {
357        final int abgr = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(packed);
358        final float r = forwardGamma((abgr & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
359        final float g = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 8 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
360        final float b = forwardGamma((abgr >>> 16 & 0xFF) * 0x1.010101010101p-8f);
361
362        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
363        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
364        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
365
366        // XYZ to Luv
367        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
368//        float L = 1.16f * y - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
369        if (L < 0.00001f) {
370            L = 0;
371            U = 0;
372            V = 0;
373        } else {
374            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
375            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
376        }
377
378        // Luv to Lch
379        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
380        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
381
382        // Lch to HSLuv
383        if (L > 0.99999f) {
384            s = 0;
385            l = 1;
386        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
387            s = 0;
388            l = 0;
389        } else {
390            l = forwardLight(L);
391            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
392        }
393        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
394                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
395                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
396                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
397                        | (abgr & 0xFE000000));
398    }
399
400    /**
401     * Takes RGBA components from 0.0 to 1.0 each and converts to a packed float in the HSLuv format this uses.
402     * @param r red, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
403     * @param g green, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
404     * @param b blue, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
405     * @param a alpha, from 0.0 to 1.0 (both inclusive)
406     * @return a packed float as HSLuv, which this class can use
407     */
408    public static float fromRGBA(float r, float g, float b, final float a) {
409        r = forwardGamma(r);
410        g = forwardGamma(g);
411        b = forwardGamma(b);
412
413        final float x = /* forwardXYZ */(0.4124564f * r  + 0.3575761f * g + 0.1804375f * b);
414        final float y = /* forwardXYZ */(0.2126729f * r  + 0.7151522f * g + 0.0721750f * b);
415        final float z = /* forwardXYZ */(0.0193339f * r  + 0.1191920f * g + 0.9503041f * b);
416
417        // XYZ to Luv
418        float L = 1.16f * cbrtPositive(y) - 0.16f, U, V, h, s, l;
419        if (L < 0.00001f) {
420            L = 0;
421            U = 0;
422            V = 0;
423        } else {
424            U = 13 * L * (4 * x / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refU);
425            V = 13 * L * (9 * y / (x + 15 * y + 3 * z) - refV);
426        }
427
428        // Luv to Lch
429        float C = (float)Math.sqrt(U * U + V * V);
430        h = TrigTools.atan2Turns(V, U);
431
432
433        // Lch to HSLuv
434        if (L > 0.99999f) {
435            s = 0;
436            l = 1;
437        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
438            s = 0;
439            l = 0;
440        } else {
441            l = forwardLight(L);
442            s = Math.min(C / chromaLimit(h, l), 1);
443        }
444        return BitConversion.intBitsToFloat(
445                Math.min(Math.max((int)(h * 255.999f    ), 0), 255)
446                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(s * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 8
447                        | Math.min(Math.max((int)(l * 255.999f    ), 0), 255) << 16
448                        | ((int)(a * 255f) << 24 & 0xFE000000));
449    }
450
451        /**
452         * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
453         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
454         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
455         */
456        public static int redInt(final float encoded)
457        {
458        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
459        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
460        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
461        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
462
463        // HSLuv to Lch
464        float C;
465        if (L > 0.99999f) {
466            L = 1;
467            C = 0;
468        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
469            L = 0;
470            C = 0;
471        } else
472            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
473
474        // Lch to Luv
475        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
476        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
477
478        // Luv to XYZ
479        float x, y, z;
480        if (L < 0.00001f) {
481            x = 0;
482            y = 0;
483            z = 0;
484        } else {
485            if (L <= 0.08f)
486                y = L / kappa;
487            else {
488                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
489                y *= y * y;
490            }
491            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
492            float varU = U * iL + refU;
493            float varV = V * iL + refV;
494            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
495            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
496        }
497        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
498        }
499
500        /**
501         * Gets the green channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
502         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
503         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the green channel value of the given encoded color
504         */
505        public static int greenInt(final float encoded)
506        {
507        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
508        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
509        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
510        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
511
512        // HSLuv to Lch
513        float C;
514        if (L > 0.99999f) {
515            L = 1;
516            C = 0;
517        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
518            L = 0;
519            C = 0;
520        } else
521            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
522
523        // Lch to Luv
524        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
525        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
526
527        // Luv to XYZ
528        float x, y, z;
529        if (L < 0.00001f) {
530            x = 0;
531            y = 0;
532            z = 0;
533        } else {
534            if (L <= 0.08f)
535                y = L / kappa;
536            else {
537                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
538                y *= y * y;
539            }
540            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
541            float varU = U * iL + refU;
542            float varV = V * iL + refV;
543            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
544            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
545        }
546        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(-0.9692660f * x + +1.8760108f * y + +0.0415560f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
547        }
548
549        /**
550         * Gets the blue channel value of the given encoded color, as an int ranging from 0 to 255, inclusive.
551         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
552         * @return an int from 0 to 255, inclusive, representing the blue channel value of the given encoded color
553         */
554        public static int blueInt(final float encoded)
555        {
556        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
557        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
558        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
559        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
560
561        // HSLuv to Lch
562        float C;
563        if (L > 0.99999f) {
564            L = 1;
565            C = 0;
566        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
567            L = 0;
568            C = 0;
569        } else
570            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
571
572        // Lch to Luv
573        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
574        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
575
576        // Luv to XYZ
577        float x, y, z;
578        if (L < 0.00001f) {
579            x = 0;
580            y = 0;
581            z = 0;
582        } else {
583            if (L <= 0.08f)
584                y = L / kappa;
585            else {
586                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
587                y *= y * y;
588            }
589            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
590            float varU = U * iL + refU;
591            float varV = V * iL + refV;
592            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
593            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
594        }
595        return (int)(reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+0.0556434f * x + -0.2040259f * y + +1.0572252f * z, 0f), 1f)) * 255.999f);
596        }
597
598        /**
599         * Gets the alpha channel value of the given encoded color, as an even int ranging from 0 to 254, inclusive. Because
600         * of how alpha is stored in libGDX, no odd-number values are possible for alpha.
601         * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
602         * @return an even int from 0 to 254, inclusive, representing the alpha channel value of the given encoded color
603         */
604        public static int alphaInt(final float encoded)
605        {
606                return (BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded) & 0xfe000000) >>> 24;
607        }
608    /**
609     * Gets the red channel value of the given encoded color, as a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive.
610     * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
611     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the red channel value of the given encoded color
612     */
613    public static float red(final float encoded)
614    {
615        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);
616        float H = ((decoded & 0xff) / 255f);
617        float S = ((decoded >>> 8 & 0xff) / 255f);
618        float L = reverseLight((decoded >>> 16 & 0xff) / 255f);
619
620        // HSLuv to Lch
621        float C;
622        if (L > 0.99999f) {
623            L = 1;
624            C = 0;
625        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
626            L = 0;
627            C = 0;
628        } else
629            C = chromaLimit(H, L) * S;
630
631        // Lch to Luv
632        float U = TrigTools.cosTurns(H) * C;
633        float V = TrigTools.sinTurns(H) * C;
634
635        // Luv to XYZ
636        float x, y, z;
637        if (L < 0.00001f) {
638            x = 0;
639            y = 0;
640            z = 0;
641        } else {
642            if (L <= 0.08f)
643                y = L / kappa;
644            else {
645                y = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
646                y *= y * y;
647            }
648            float iL = 1f / (13f * L);
649            float varU = U * iL + refU;
650            float varV = V * iL + refV;
651            x = 9 * varU * y / (4 * varV);
652            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
653        }
654        return reverseGamma(Math.min(Math.max(+3.2404542f * x + -1.5371385f * y + -0.4985314f * z, 0f), 1f));
655    }

657    /**
658     * Gets the green channel value of the given encoded color, as a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive.
659     * @param encoded a color as a packed float that can be obtained by {@link #hsluv(float, float, float, float)}
660     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the green channel value of the given encoded color
661     */
662    public static float green(final float encoded)
663    {
664        final int decoded = BitConversion.floatToRawIntBits(encoded);

668

672            L = 1;

677        } else

701            z = (3 * y / varV) - x / 3 - 5 * y;
702        }

704    }

709     * @return a float from 0.0f to 1.0f, inclusive, representing the blue channel value of the given encoded color
710     */

723        } else if (L < 0.00001f) {
724            L = 0;
725            C = 0;
726        } else
